author: jgm
content:
Is there something up with `SyncCommittee` and the latest Altair spec release?  It appears that both Lodestar and Prysm changed their `SyncCommittee` spec tests to point to `SyncAggregate` for some reason (e.g. https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/pull/2728/commits/10517d421fc6ab2cb258251d55743994da075e48 for Lodestar).

My `SyncCommittee` implementation fails on the spec tests, specifically on calculating the hash tree root.  Given `SyncCommittee` is a simple list of 512 public keys followed by a public key I'm struggling to understand why.

author: jgm
content: (btw <@&595681771690000403> it would be awesome if https://simpleserialize.com/ were updated with altair types)

author: ajsutton
content: We're running alpha.7.  The SyncCommitteeSignature data structure was renamed to SyncCommitteeMessage.

author: megamanx666
content:
noted!  made an issue for it here:
https://github.com/ChainSafe/simpleserialize.com/issues/37

author: jgm
content: Thanks.  So that wasn't related to my error, which of course I found a few minutes after posting (I was adding the array of BLS public keys without merklizing each one as I went).
